documents.title: Employee Handbook - Working Hours Policy
documents.content:
WORKING HOURS AND OVERTIME

Standard Working Hours:
Our standard working week is 40 hours, typically structured as:
- Monday to Friday: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM (with 1 hour lunch break)
- Total: 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week

Flexible Working:
Departments may implement flexible working arrangements with core hours from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM, allowing employees to adjust their start and end times within reason, subject to manager approval.

Overtime:
Non-exempt employees who work beyond 40 hours per week are entitled to overtime compensation at 1.5 times their regular hourly rate. All overtime must be pre-approved by department managers.

Exempt employees (managerial and professional staff) are not entitled to overtime pay but may be granted time off in lieu at the discretion of management.

Time Recording:
All employees must accurately record their working hours using the company time tracking system. Failure to do so may result in delayed salary payments or disciplinary action.

Rest Days:
Employees are entitled to at least one rest day per week, typically Saturday or Sunday. When operational requirements necessitate work on a rest day, employees will receive a substitute rest day within the same month.

documents.title: Employment Contract - Schedule of Terms
documents.content:
SCHEDULE A: TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

HOURS OF WORK

1. Normal Working Hours:
   The Employee's normal working hours are forty (40) hours per week, distributed as follows:
   - Working Days: Monday to Friday
   - Working Hours: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM
   - Meal Break: 1 hour (unpaid), typically 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM or 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM

2. Flexible Working Arrangements:
   Subject to operational requirements and with prior approval from the Employee's immediate supervisor, the Employee may request flexible working hours. Core business hours are 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM, during which all employees must be available.

3. Overtime:
   For non-exempt employees: Overtime work exceeding 40 hours per week must be authorized in advance and will be compensated at 1.5 times the regular hourly rate.
   
   For exempt employees: Managerial and professional employees are not entitled to overtime compensation but may be granted compensatory time off at management's discretion.

4. Rest Days:
   The Employee is entitled to not less than one rest day in every period of seven days. The regular rest day is Saturday or Sunday unless otherwise notified.

documents.title: HR Policy Guide - Attendance and Hours
documents.content:
ATTENDANCE AND WORKING HOURS POLICY

1. Standard Schedule
Full-time employees work 40 hours per week on the following schedule:
- Days: Monday through Friday
- Hours: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM (8 hours per day)
- Lunch: 1-hour unpaid break

2. Flexibility Options
We offer flexible working arrangements where business needs permit:
- Core Hours: 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM (must be present)
- Flexible Start: Between 8:00 AM - 10:00 AM
- Flexible End: Between 4:00 PM - 7:00 PM
- Requires manager approval

3. Overtime Policy
Non-Exempt Staff:
- Overtime is hours worked beyond 40 per week
- Paid at 1.5x regular hourly rate
- Must be pre-approved by manager
- Recorded in time tracking system

Exempt Staff:
- Management and professional roles
- Not eligible for overtime pay
- May receive time off in lieu (manager's discretion)

4. Weekly Rest Day
All employees receive at least one rest day per seven-day period, normally Saturday or Sunday. If required to work on a designated rest day, a substitute rest day will be provided within the same month.

5. Time Tracking
Employees must clock in/out daily using the company's electronic time tracking system. Accurate time records are essential for payroll processing.
